intro: Seychellaria africana, commonly known as the African seychellaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals that bloom in late summer. Seychellaria africana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and seasonal blooms.
